new_zealand_cuisines.name: Pavlova
new_zealand_cuisines.description: Delicate as the ballerina it was named after, Pavlova is the quintessential summer dessert. Whipped cream is typically dolloped on top of a snowy meringue, followed by a pop of color in the form of fruit, preferably the tart varieties which contrast the sweetness of the meringue.

new_zealand_cuisines.name: Meat Pie
new_zealand_cuisines.description: Australian and New Zealander meat pie is made with flaky pastry that is filled with gravy and minced meat. Numerous variations exist, with fillings such as onions, chicken, asparagus, mushrooms, cheese, crocodile meat, vegetables, or seafood.

new_zealand_cuisines.name: Fish and Chips
new_zealand_cuisines.description: This dish is a New Zealander version of the classic English fish and chips, introduced before World War I by British settlers. It is traditionally served wrapped in newspaper and eaten on a Friday night as a takeaway treat.

new_zealand_cuisines.name: Māori Boil-Up
new_zealand_cuisines.description: Boil-up is a unique Māori technique of preparing meat and vegetables by boiling them in a large pot filled with water. The meat can be pork, beef, chicken, goat, or lamb, and typical vegetables include watercress, potatoes, and carrots.

new_zealand_cuisines.name: Bacon and Egg Pie
new_zealand_cuisines.description: Bacon and egg pie is a New Zealand favorite made from flaky pastry filled with egg yolks and salty bacon. It is a common picnic food and is often eaten cold with ketchup or other condiments.

new_zealand_cuisines.name: Anzac Biscuits
new_zealand_cuisines.description: Anzac biscuits are sweet cookies made from flour, oats, golden syrup, butter, sugar, coconut, and baking soda. Both Australia and New Zealand claim to have invented these cookies, with the first recipe appearing in 1915.

new_zealand_cuisines.name: Hokey Pokey Ice Cream
new_zealand_cuisines.description: Hokey Pokey is a New Zealand ice cream consisting of vanilla-flavored ice cream with lumps of honeycomb toffee. It has become so popular that it is regularly exported to Japan, where it has gained a loyal following.

new_zealand_cuisines.name: Sausage Sizzle
new_zealand_cuisines.description: Sausage sizzle is a popular community event where sausages are grilled or barbecued, often as part of fundraisers. It is common at public gatherings or charity events and is typically served with bread, onions, and condiments.

new_zealand_cuisines.name: Cheese Roll
new_zealand_cuisines.description: Cheese roll is a New Zealand snack made by rolling crustless white bread filled with cheese and onions, then grilling it and topping with butter.

new_zealand_cuisines.name: Krispie
new_zealand_cuisines.description: Krispie is a toasted biscuit made with wheat flour, sugar, and coconut. They have a crunchy texture and are often commercially produced by Griffin's Foods.

new_zealand_cuisines.name: Pikelets
new_zealand_cuisines.description: Pikelets are small, thick pancakes popular in New Zealand and Australia, typically eaten for breakfast and served with butter or jam.

new_zealand_cuisines.name: Whitebait Fritters
new_zealand_cuisines.description: Whitebait fritters are a delicacy made by frying tiny whitebait fish in a batter made from eggs and flour, seasoned with salt and pepper.

new_zealand_cuisines.name: Jaffas
new_zealand_cuisines.description: Jaffas are small, round chocolate balls covered in a red-orange flavor coating. They were first produced in 1931 and are named after the Jaffa orange.

new_zealand_cuisines.name: Chocolate Fish
new_zealand_cuisines.description: Chocolate fish is a New Zealand confectionery consisting of marshmallow shaped like fish, covered in chocolate. It has been a favorite treat for children in New Zealand.

new_zealand_cuisines.name: KiwiBurger
new_zealand_cuisines.description: The Kiwiburger consists of a beef patty, fried egg, beetroot, grilled onions, and other ingredients such as tomato, lettuce, cheese, mustard, and ketchup.

new_zealand_cuisines.name: Mince and Cheese Pie
new_zealand_cuisines.description: Mince and cheese pie is a traditional New Zealand meal consisting of a shortcrust pastry shell filled with cheese cubes and minced meat, typically made with ground beef, onions, garlic, carrots, mushrooms, and tomato paste.

new_zealand_cuisines.name: Lolly Cake
new_zealand_cuisines.description: Lolly cake is a New Zealand dessert made from crushed malt biscuits, marshmallows, butter, and condensed milk. It is often topped with grated coconut and served sliced.

new_zealand_cuisines.name: Hāngi
new_zealand_cuisines.description: Hāngi is a traditional Māori cooking technique where food is cooked in an underground oven. This technique involves placing food in a pit lined with heated stones and cooking it slowly.

new_zealand_cuisines.name: Jelly Slice
new_zealand_cuisines.description: Jelly slice is a colorful dessert made with a cookie base, creamy custard, and a layer of jelly on top, often served in vibrant red colors.

new_zealand_cuisines.name: Afghan Biscuit
new_zealand_cuisines.description: Afghan biscuits are crispy cookies made from crushed cornflakes, butter, cocoa, and sugar. They are typically shaped into flattened balls and baked until firm.
